Why You Won’t Want to Miss This
A rare opportunity to experience Claudio’s unique fusion of world music traditions and healing sound
A deeply immersive, meditative experience—perfect for relaxation and renewal
Limited spaces
Event followed by a plant-based dinner and dessert, all included in your ticket!
Meet Your Host: Claudio Escutia
Born into a musical family in Mexico City, Claudio’s lifelong passion for sound has taken him across the globe—from studying jazz in Montreal to mastering Tibetan singing bowls in Kathmandu. His music weaves together classical training, world instruments (Sitar, Esraj, Harmonium, and more), and a deep reverence for sound as medicine.
Ready to unwind and recharge through the magic of vibration?
Learn more or listen to Claudio’s music here:
SoundCloud: Claudio EscutiaInstagram: Claudio Escutia Yoga and Sound Healing (@claudio_yoga_sound_healing)Facebook: Claudio Escutia Yoga - Sound Healing- Music
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall, $20
Limited door sales for $25
Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket - or whatever it is you need to feel most warm and comfortable
Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm. As you settle into the experience, allow the soothing tones to wash over you, releasing tension and promoting a sense of inner peace.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being. The rhythmic patterns and overtones of the gongs can help entrain brainwaves, leading to a meditative state and improved mental clarity.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session. By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.
Whether you're looking to unwind after a long day or explore new avenues of self-care, this 1-hour gong bath offers a unique opportunity to reconnect with yourself and find balance amidst the hustle and bustle of daily life. There will be cups of tea available afterwards to help us integrate and ground.
THIS EVENT IS RESTRICTED TO 40 PEOPLE ONLY
About Me
Erika is a musician and astrologer based in Te Whanganui-a-Tara. She has 30+ years musical experience. Erika has an interest in the healing properties of sound for mental and physical wellbeing, which she currently explores through her gong bathing practice
label: Health & Wellness

description:
Sika Sound Journey, This powerful experience is like a soundtrack that is crafted to go with your life.

Something between an ancient ceremony and a movie soundtrack.

Please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket. Be prepared to drop into a deep space.
Door sales will be available if there is space. Advanced booking is recommended.

Sika's Sound Journeys are truly unique. They are sonic explorations that feature didgeridoos, drums, flutes, voice and orchestral elements. A collection of foraged sounds from objects he has recorded in nature, add even more textures. Many of his sounds are completely unrecognisable and abstract. Immersed in this cocoon of abstract sound, we can find ourselves in the most surprising places in our mind. In this timeless realm, beyond the normal limitations of rational reality, anything is possible.

An epic adventure deep inside yourself.

Journey to worlds within worlds on incredible sound waves.

Sika creates a safe space to relax deeply and connect with our inner guidance. This Sound Journey begins and ends with a short guided visualisation.

There will be two journeys with an interval. Most people choose to lie down, so once again, please bring a yoga mat, pillow and blanket to get really comfortable.

A journal is also recommended.

description:
(Now on Sunday) Planetary Parade - Free event, Due to a heavy cloud forecast on Saturday morning, we have changed the date for this event to the following morning, Sunday 24 August.
A rare cosmic event where six of the seven planets are in dawn sky during this final Planetary Parade for 2025. Matariki is also visible at this time close to the line of planets.
Come down to the Wellington waterfront at dawn and see the planets Pareārau (Saturn), Kōpū/Tāwera (Venus), Hine-i-tīweka (Jupiter), Whiro (Mercury), and Matariki (Pleiades) in our skies. Rangipō (Uranus) and Tangaroa (Neptune) are also in the sky but they will be too faint to see. Matawhero (Mars) follows after Te Rā (the Sun) rises so it won't be seen in the sky.
If you want to gaze in wonder at Saturn, Jupiter, Venus, look through our amazing telescopes! We can show you where to find Matariki, but binoculars at better so if you have a pair bring them along. The event is child friendly and free!

description:
Astronomy on Tap, Experience the wonders of the Universe as you embark on an extraordinary journey into the vast depths of space and beyond.
This August our theme is the James Webb Space Telescope and beyond! The JWST has been in orbit for over 3 years now. In this edition of Astronomy on Tap we’ll take a closer look at some of the amazing images and discoveries JWST has so far accomplished, what is yet to come, and how other telescopes up in space are adding to our knowledge of the cosmos.
Upon arrival, receive a drink and your first-class inflight snacks. Then sit back and relax in our digital full-dome planetarium as we explore the night sky. Complete your trip through the galaxy with the cash bar and a look through interactive exhibitions.
Whether you’re accompanied by a special someone, a friend, or embarking on a solo adventure, raise your glass to the stars and enjoy the stellar ride.
$45pp | 8PM – 10PM | R18 | Space Place

description:
FULLY BOOKED - Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.

description:
Bar Crossing Seminar - Manawatū (Foxton bar), Crossing A Bar? We Can Help
Bar crossings can be one of the trickiest, and riskiest parts of boating in Aotearoa. They change fast, they don’t always play nice, and they’ve caught out even the most experienced skippers. Each year, we see serious incidents and tragedies happening on our bars, so it’s super important to know your stuff before you head out.
That’s where we come in. Join us at Manawatu Marine Boating Club for a free and relaxed seminar. You’ll hear straight from local Coastguard skippers and boating legends who’ll share their real-world tips, local knowledge, and a few stories from the water.

Here’s what we’ll cover (and chat about):

Understanding the local features of your bar
Reading and interpreting the conditions when planning a trip
Getting your boat and your crew bar crossing ready
How to handle your boat while crossing
How to do a bar crossing report (and why it’s worth it)
What to do if things go pear-shaped
It’s interactive – so bring your questions, share your own experiences, and have a yarn with others in the boating community.
Bring your mates too – whether they’re brand new to boating or have been around since the days of paper charts and handheld compasses, there’s something in here that could save a trip… or a life.
 Why it matters:
In 2024, 23% of craft-related drownings happened during bar crossings.
5 lives were lost due to capsizing while crossing a bar.
Older blokes are still the most at-risk – but everyone can make safer choices with the right knowledge (and a lifejacket on).

description:
Awesome Astro: A practical introduction to night sky photography, Learn how to photograph the night sky with this three-part workshop.
Always wanted to capture the Milky Way but don't know where to start? Or you've tried and the results haven't been amazing?
We've designed this workshop for beginner astro photographers: to take you from zero astro knowledge to being able to capture at least one awesome astro photo to impress friends and family.
Wellington-based astro and landscape photographer Chris McKeown, and supported by Sony Advocate Rebecca McMillan, will guide you through what's required to plan, shoot, and process stunning images of the incredible night sky in Wellington.
We will start with an online introductory tutorial briefing on Sunday 17th August (evening), to discuss settings and camera gear, answer questions and confirm the meetup location for the Thursday evening workshop.
On Saturday 23 August we will meet from 7.30pm on Wellington's South Coast to capture the night sky. (A rain check date will be advised if required. The following evening we will host an online tutorial to demonstrate how to process your images, with time for Q&A.
We also have the opportunity to access Sony cameras for the workshop: please get in touch with the organisers at least two weeks ahead of the event if you would like to borrow gear for this workshop.
This is a ticketed workshop via Sony Scene.

description:
Unity Book Club: Before the Winter Ends, Melissa and Eden host our monthly book club to discuss some of the excellent recently released books.
For the month of August we will be discussing Before the Winter Ends by Khadro Mohamed.
In the cold Wellington winter, Omar’s grades are slipping, his mum is unwell and his best friend is growing distant. Two decades earlier in Mogadishu, Asha and Yasser are falling in love and starting to build a life together while a burgeoning war threatens to take it away.
Before the Winter Ends explores the relationship between mother and son across Aotearoa New Zealand, Somalia and Egypt as they search for understanding and try to bridge the distance between them. Khadro Mohamed’s debut novel is a stark portrayal of how the past illuminates the present and how grief shapes a family.
Limited tickets available so grab a ticket sooner, rather than later and tell your friends and whānau. Drinks and snacks are provided.

Sit back and enjoy being taken on a detailed tour of the night sky with our high-definition laser projectors.

Life Drawing Meets Yoga!, Connect with your body and your creativity in this all-levels workshop that combines vinyasa yoga practice with a fun and interactive Life Drawing class!

A unique experience where movement meets mark-making. We begin with yoga and flow into life drawing until the two become naturally intertwined.

The drawing process is fully guided and inspired by the philosophies and methods of British artist Cecil Collins, encouraging a non-academic, intuitive approach. Through playful interaction with asana, the connection between these two practices becomes beautifully apparent.

Drinks and nibbles follow, along with a chance for kōrero and connection.

Guided by JoElle Gragilla, owner of Island Bay’s South Coast Studio, and AWHI yoga teacher Lachlan Broughton.

Encouraging expression over perfection, this experience is open to all levels and accessible to both artists and non-artists alike.

Come curious. Leave inspired.

Investment
$75 (includes all drawing materials, yoga, mat hire, drinks & nibbles)

All supplies & props provided — wear comfortable clothing to move in!

description:
Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington, Escape to the Dramatic Coast: Private Cape Palliser Day Trip from Wellington
Are you looking for a unique and unforgettable day trip from Wellington?
Imagine yourself surrounded by breathtaking coastal scenery, watching playful seals in their natural habitat, and standing in the shadow of a historic lighthouse with panoramic ocean views.
As your dedicated travel and adventure tour guide, I offer exclusive, low-key private tours to Cape Palliser, perfect for individuals, couples, or families seeking a personalized and enriching experience.
What's in store for you:
Personalized Pick-up & Drop-off: Enjoy the convenience of being picked up and dropped off directly from your Wellington accommodation.
Scenic Coastal Drive: Relax in comfort as we journey through picturesque landscapes, including the stunning Remutaka Hill Road and the rugged Wairarapa coastline.
Marvel at the Putangirua Pinnacles: Explore the otherworldly rock formations made famous by "Lord of the Rings."
Encounter the Cape Palliser Seal Colony: Witness a thriving colony of New Zealand fur seals up close (from a safe and respectful distance).
Discover the Iconic Cape Palliser Lighthouse: Climb (or admire from below) the iconic red and white striped lighthouse and soak in the incredible views.
Flexible & Relaxed Pace: This is your private tour, so we'll move at a comfortable pace and can tailor the day to your interests.
Gourmet Options Available (upon request & additional cost): Elevate your experience with a pre-arranged gourmet picnic lunch or inquire about other bespoke dining options featuring local flavors.
Expert Guidance: Benefit from my local knowledge, insights into the region's history, geology, and wildlife, ensuring a truly engaging experience.
Perfect for Photography Enthusiasts: Capture stunning photos of dramatic landscapes and unique wildlife.
Who is this tour for?
This private Cape Palliser day trip is ideal for:
Individuals seeking a solo adventure.
Couples looking for a romantic and scenic escape.
Families wanting a memorable and educational day out.
Anyone who appreciates beautiful scenery, wildlife encounters, and a relaxed, personalized travel experience.
Those who value quality and are happy to invest in a private tour.
Date & Time: Flexible - Contact me to discuss your preferred dates and times.
Duration: Approximately 8-9 hours (can be adjusted slightly based on your preferences).
Price: Pricing is tailored to the number of people in your group and any additional requests (e.g., gourmet lunch). Please message me for a personalized quote.
Booking:
Send me a direct message to discuss your preferred dates, group size, and any specific interests you may have. I'm happy to answer any questions and create a bespoke itinerary for you.
Don't miss out on this opportunity to experience the magic of Cape Palliser on your own terms!

description:
The Napier Escape, Saturday 23rd August 2025 – Learn, Indulge or Explore in Napier
Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options.
A Deco Deep Dive
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.

Steam Incorporated's Napier Escape excursion in August 2025 offers a captivating diesel-hauled journey through New Zealand's North Island, blending heritage rail travel with the region's stunning landscapes. Departing from Paekākāriki, our beautifully restored heritage train traverses the picturesque countryside, culminating in the Art Deco city of Napier, to showcase the best of the region.
Board the special train at Paekakariki, Paraparaumu, Waikanae, Otaki, Levin, Palmerston North or Woodville.
Passengers will experience the comfort of classic red steel carriages, complete with an open-air viewing platform for unobstructed views of the diverse scenery, hauled by one of our beautifully restored Art Deco-inspired diesel electric locomotives. Onboard amenities include a buffet counter offering a selection of snacks and beverages.
The journey includes traversing engineering marvels such as the Manawatū Gorge, accessible only by rail, providing a unique perspective of the monumental slips that closed the Gorge to road traffic in 2017, and the famed Ormondville Viaduct, a 280m long and 39m high spectacle in the Central Hawkes Bay.
Upon arrival in Napier, passengers can immerse themselves in one of three fantastic options. Choose from the following to enhance your day:
A Deco Deep Dive
The City’s Art Deco heritage is a defining feature of the city, shaped by a remarkable chapter in its history. After a devastating earthquake in 1931 levelled much of the city, Napier was rebuilt in the architectural style of the time—Art Deco.
Influenced by the glamour and optimism of the early 20th century, the new buildings featured bold geometric patterns, sunbursts, zigzags, and elegant façades that have since become iconic. ‘The Art Deco Experience’ includes a visit to the Art Deco Centre and a guided 1hr bus tour of Napier with a tour guide from the Art Deco Trust.
Sip, Savour, and Soak in the Views
Travel by coach from Hastings through to the Northern reaches of Napier, towards Bay View, and disembark at the Crab Farm Winery to indulge in a special wine tasting and late lunch opportunity from a beautifully crafted set menu.
Crab Farm Winery was established in the early 1980’s with the first vintage under the Crab Farm Winery label released in 1987. The land at Crab Farm has been in the Jardine family for over 100 years. Originally purchased without viewing beforehand – Hamish Jardine’s great grandfather was alarmed to find his new land was actually partially underwater. With tidal pools, rushes and hundreds of Crabs, the family jokingly named it ‘Crab Farm’.
Napier at your Leisure
Enjoy a few hours of free time in Napier’s vibrant CBD—perfect for discovering the city at your own pace. Wander among world-famous Art Deco buildings, stroll the scenic Marine Parade, or relax at a local café with a Hawke’s Bay treat. Visit MTG Hawke’s Bay for a dose of culture, browse boutique shops, or admire the colourful street art. It’s your chance to soak up Napier’s unique charm your way.
For all timetable, pricing & more information - head to www.steaminc.org.nz/book-train-trip/the-napier-escape/

description:
Club Night - Fireside Chat with Mark and Gavin, it's all about the punt!, Ever wondered what’s really involved in lifting your chains, checking your blocks, and keeping your boat secure inside the harbour?
Come along and hear Gavin and Mark share their knowledge — including Gavin’s tale of installing blocks for Revenue Cutter inside the boat harbour, and how a “mooring muscle boy” became a rocket!
You’ll learn:
How to inspect chains and spot potential issues
Why regular servicing (every 2 years) is the best protection in heavy winds
The story of the Punt — over 100 years old and still servicing moorings in Clyde Quay
The Mooring Punt isn’t a dark art — it’s a simple winch with rollers that does an important job. This is your chance to see how it works, ask questions, and even book a slot to have your mooring serviced so you can sleep well knowing your boat is secure.

description:
Family Shiny - Akatarawa Forestt, Registrations open NOW
What to expect
This is a “Family Shiny” trip into the Akatarawa Forest.
Non members are welcome to join us but must register to obtain details of start time and location.
Vehicles must have a low ratio gearbox and must not be a 4wd car, station wagon or van, and if a soft top must have a roll cage.
Visitor Registration- $20.00 per driver
There is no trip fee for this trip however non-members pay a “Day Membership Fee” of $20. This is payable in Cash to the Trip Leader on the day.
The trip should be relatively easy as it needs to cater for people just starting out and all types of 4wd vehicles – but a good way to see if you want to get into 4wding and a chance to meet some of our club members (if you are unsure if your vehicle is suitable just ask).
No Dogs Allowed sorry
Once you have completed 3 Family Shinys you can join the club but can only participate in Family Shiny or Touring Class trips. Once you have also done a Training Day and had your vehicle inspected by one of our approved inspectors you can come along on our other more adventurous trips. To find out more on how to join our club go to https://ccvcwellington.wildapricot.org/page-1725861.
Like our Facebook page to find out about more trips and club nights.

description:
F*ck the Small Talk: Wellington #6, Sign up here: https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6
F*ck the Small Talk has traveled the world from Berlin, Melbourne, London, Lisbon, and Mexico City, to Lisbon and is now coming to Wellington!

WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?
FTST is a one-of-a-kind social experience where strangers come together for an afternoon of meaningful, fun, and deep conversation. It’s also just a different & cool way of meeting new people by getting a bit out of your comfort zone and skipping the small talk!
Join us for games, talks, and connections with friends you haven’t met yet. Join if you get annoyed after being asked what you do, where you are from, and how long you have been in Wellington every single time you meet someone. If you feel that there are better questions in life then this is the place for you.

HOW DOES IT WORK?
We start with a short & sweet intro talk followed by a few light-hearted group games to warm up. Don't worry, nothing too awkward! After that, we split you up into small groups and start with the conversation rounds (with 3-4 people). We'll have awesome question cards that will guide the flow of the conversation. You’ll never have to speak in public if you don’t want to!

HOW TO JOIN?
Take 2 minutes to fill out our form

https://lu.ma/ftstwellington6
Our events are limited to 30 handpicked guests to ensure a cozy atmosphere. We prioritize a balance in gender and cultural diversity, making each gathering a unique blend of perspectives! If you're invited you'll receive an invite with a special link via our ticketing platform Luma

HOW MUCH IS IT?
The cost to attend is NZD 23 (early llama) - NZD 25 (general llama) and includes the following:
3 hours of facilitated and curated activities
Light snacks to keep the energy going (only if outdoors)
A space to meet new people in the least boring way possible
Supporting our mission to slowly eliminate small talk around the world
Also includes those pesky ticket fees!

WHERE IS IT?
We host our events in awesome cafes, rooftops, and bars across the city. We only reveal the location to ticket holders 24 hours before the event.

WHAT THEY SAY
“Great way to connect with people in a more meaningful way. Get to the heart of the matter, dive straight into what really counts!” - Matthias

“This is the kind of activity humanity needs every weekend. Thank you for all.” - Sonya

“F*ck the Small Talk changes the narrative from "Where are you from?" to "When was the last time you laughed uncontrollably?" and I think that's beautiful.” - Monika

“I loved F*ck the small talk, I was a little bit nervous at first but they are pros at making you feel comfortable with the rest of the group, the activities are really fun and I enjoyed every second (consider that the one who's saying this is very, very shy). Give it a try!” - Brenda

"it’s a wonderful experience, it’s like being a kid again, when you were at the park, playing with other kids, and just decided you were going to be best friends for the next hours. Maybe you’ll never see those kids again. But that hour was amazing because you both opened up and trusted each other." - Sara

“Lively, interesting, introspective, completely open and no judgement. Everyone that joined was ready for great conversation and helped with different perspectives. So much fun! I can't wait for the next one! “ - Yaz

Check out our 100+ Google reviews: https://goo.gl/maps/TpZy77bfPFkGoikn7

FAQ
• Can I come alone?
Of course, in fact, we encourage it! 99% of people do.

• I signed up but never got an invite. Why?
We usually get a high volume of sign-ups yet we like to keep it cozy & only about 30 people. We believe this is a good number to ensure an awesome experience! Please try again next time if do not receive an invite - no hard feelings

• Why do you charge?
We value our time and put a lot of love, planning, and effort into creating & designing these experiences.
This is our project/business and what we give to the world and we think everything should be a fair exchange! However, money should never be the reason for people not to attend. If you can’t afford it simply get in touch with us

• I'm digging this! Can I get involved somehow?
Sure thing, send us a message!

• Can I bring my cute dog/llama?
It depends on where the event is! Message us to make sure. But it's always a YES in our hearts.

• Can I get a refund if I can't make it?
Unfortunately, we do not offer refunds or ticket transfers to another event date if you cannot attend with a notice of less than 5 days notice. BUTTTT feel free to pass on your ticket to a friend, provided they also sign up for the form
--

𝘾𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙘𝙪𝙧𝙞𝙤𝙪𝙨, 𝙡𝙚𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙚𝙙.
* Only 30 spots available
* Location is only revealed to ticket holders!
* Age guide, 22-40 years old (only a reference, never a limit
)

This event is a no-phone experience. Keep them tucked in your pocket

We started in Berlin back in 2019 out our frustration of being asked 'where are you from?' 40 times in one week. Now there are chapters in 11 cities around the world including Mexico City, Zurich, Lisbon, London, Berlin and Vancouver.

--
Stay in touch
Website: https://www.epicllama.com/fuckthesmalltalk
Instagram: www.instagram.com/epic.llama/
Join the club (newsletter): epicllama.myflodesk.com/wellington

description:
Pinhole Photography - Three Day Creative Arts holiday programme, Did you know that any object that can be made light tight can be turned into a camera? Come along to this three-day workshop and choose an object – it could be a tea pot, a book, a coffee jar – to turn into a pinhole camera to then create black and white photographs with.

We’ll work in the darkroom and explore the process of loading your camera with silver gelatin paper, before making exposures in the garden around the historic Inverlochy house, testing different angles and perspectives. We’ll then return to the darkroom to develop your photographic negative, and print it as a positive. You’ll leave the course with a series of atmospheric pinhole photographs, having experienced the magic of hands-on darkroom printing.

Bring a water bottle and morning tea. Recommended age for this course is tweens & teens ages 10 and above.

Monday - Wednesday, 22 - 24 September, 10 am - 1 pm daily.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including pottery, jewellery making, animation and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:

You will have the option of creating your orb into a hanging planter or a unique decoration for your room or garden. Teens will learn basic hand-building techniques to create with clay.

The pieces will be decorated with underglaze and fired. All art will be ready for pickup approximately 3 weeks later depending on drying times.

Recommended age for this workshop is tweens & teens ages 10 and above.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, jewellery making, animation and sewing head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:
Drawing & Painting - Creative Arts Holiday Programme for Tween & Teens, Join us for a fun beginner friendly workshop for keen young artists interested in drawing and painting.

Over two sessions, tutor Jake Fairweather will lead participants through a series of exercises designed help improve your drawing and painting.

Workshop goals include:
- Identify the key aspects of a scene to focus on
- How to hatch in various ways to describe the form and express different feelings
- How to tell a story through composition and colour
- How to push the story even further by modifying the lighting and shadows
- Discover your personal drawing and painting style
- Develop greater proficiency with graphite pencil and acrylic paint

Tuesday and Wednesday, 23 & 24 September, 10 am - 1 pm daily.
Suitable for ages 10 and above.

This workshop is part of Inverlochy Art School's September School Holiday Programme. For more teen & tween workshops including photography, jewellery making, animation, sewing and pottery head to the 'Tamariki and Teens' section of our website.

description:
The Art of Mending, This class is cared for by the whimsical Aisha, a multidisciplinary artist with a passion for empowering the mending process. Each month on Wednesday evenings Aisha will introduce us to a different technique for reviving our beloved textile pieces. If you're like us and have a box of clothing in need of repairs that never seems to empty... this is the club for you. With three events a month we'll inspire each other to creatively care for those pieces we love! This club is also perfect for anyone who loves learning new skills. Techniques we'll cover are lino printing, patching, darning, felting, embroidery, beading, sashiko, fabric painting and more! All materials and tools are supplied at each class - but you are welcome to bring your own and we highly encourage bringing a textile item (or many!) to fix up.
In August we're lino printing!
Class 01: 13th August
In this class we'll get an introduction to lino printing on fabric and best practice for using this process to cover stains. Pre cut designs and all other tools are supplied. Please bring either clothing you would like to print on or some fabric scrap to make lino printed patches!
Class 02: 20th August
At this class Aisha will take us through the process of designing and cutting our own lino to print with! You're welcome to keep going with the pre cut designs as well. Lino and carving tools will be supplied.
Class 03: 27th August
This class will be open to what you want to work on! Bring in larger project items, print with the lino cuts you made in the previous week, or cut some fresh ones!

description:
Chain Maille Course, Our medieval materials expert Achille is ready to be your chain maille master. In this seven class course you will hone in on the chain weaves that incite awe and be bestowed with the agency to create a wearable piece or majestic object of your own design. On the mysterious journey towards mastery, Achille will take you through everything from the dexterity of proper ring closing, to practicing resolve through the depths of theory and mathematics that allow you to design and execute a piece of your very own creation. This is the perfect course to begin your foray into the craft of chain maille.

This course it taught by medieval enthusiast Achille. He is a creature of curiosity and crepes, having spent the last 14 years skulking around the capital publishing “woke leftist paper” as a founder of 5ever books. He has conquered our hearts, minds, and the specialty cheese departments of the local supermarkets. Achille is a master of chain maille, now offering to teach his craft to those willing to take up the challenge.

Some materials and tools are supplied. Depending on the project you choose to create there may be extra material costs, as well as the option to purchase tools for personal use. You are welcome to bring your own bent nose pliers and wire cutters if you have them.

There are variable pricing options, unwaged/student, waged, and generous. Please choose whichever option feels right for you and your circumstances! Note that this ticket is a commitment to the entire seven week course. No chain maille experience is required, just a will to delve into the depths of metal weaves. If you're unsure about committing to this craft, perhaps keep an eye out for a one off 101 chain maille class that may come in the future.

Course Outline:
Week 01 - 18th September
101: Basic Skills and Discovery
At this class we'll explore the basics of good chain maille practice.
Opening & closing rings properly
Trying out some simple structures
Begin exploring material options and how to make your own rings
Homework: keep an eye out for recycled or foraged materials that could be utilised in chain maille

Week 02 - 25th September
Play and Exploration
Gathering inspiration and looking into methods for individual projects
Playing with recycled & foraged materials
Homework: Choose a weave from the library to try out at home or explore during the next class

Week 03 - 2nd October
Mathematics of chain maille design, theory, and history.
Math of designing chain maille
Theory & pre-planning
Discussion about ideas for individual projects
Identify materials needed to execute individual designs
Homework: Choose your individual project, identify what materials you will need, and how we will source/make them.

Week 04 - 16th October
By this class you will have you project plan down. We'll be collecting/ making our materials or beginning the execution of our projects with the guidance of Achille.

Week 05 & 06 - 23rd & 30th October
These classes will be open working times to make use of tools in class, ask Achille questions or help with troubleshooting, and to share our progress, challenges, and solutions with each other.

Week 07 - 6th November
At this final class we will make finishing touches to our projects and celebrate our creations together! Perhaps including a catwalk of our chain maille wares, and sharing kai.

Fabric-a-brac is a fun fabric and sewing supplies market where you can shop for vintage and modern sewing and upholstery fabric, patterns, haberdashery and more. It brings the sewing community together to share stashes, stories and delight in our mutual love of textiles.
Fabric-a-brac is volunteer-run, and is a fundraiser for hospice - in Wellington this is Mary Potter Hospice. All profits from this event are donated to their work. We've raised $80,000 since our first event in 2009.
Selling fabric
If you have a stash you'd like to sell, you can come and take a stall. You pay a stallholder fee (which goes to Hospice) but anything you make on the day is yours to keep. Stalls are allocated via a ballot, which will take place closer to the time. Go to our website to find the form. Closes mid August.

If you have fabric, haberdashery or patterns you'd like to move on, but don't want to have a table, you can donate items. This will all go onto the hospice table on the day, and all profits will go to their wonderful work.
Fabric donation points
- Made Marion
- Mary Potter Hospice - you can take donations to the Mary Potter Hospice in Mein St, Newtown

Pop-up cafe
The fabulous cafe is back with all of its gorgeous volunteers and fab food. There will be tea, coffee and sweet treats for sale, so you can sit down and chat over your new projects and fabric purchases. All proceeds from the cafe also go to Hospice.
Buying fabric
Bring cash - most stallholders and the cafe will be selling by cash only.
We look forward to seeing our fabulous fabric and sewing community soon!

description:
Plant Sale, I have had great success with NZ and imported seed propagation this year so we have a wonderful range of plants ready to go in the ground now.
Some varieties are extremely limited due to the cost of the imported seed and the tiny amount of seeds per packet (only 5 in some cases).
We will be accepting preorders by messenger so get in quick if you don't want to miss out on these special plants.
Please note: Our garden will not be open during the plant sale. We aim to open in approximately 5 weeks but it depends how the tulips progress.
As other plants reach maturity we will make them available for sale on our open days. We have decided to have a pre season sale to make room for more beauties.
Abutilon - a range of mixed colours including peach, rose and lemon.
Dwarf Agapanthus - a fine leaved pale blue variety. Great for edging paths and beds. Will not take over.
Aubretia - Lavender trailing plant for rock walls and garden edges.
Arabis - White blooming Spring groundcover
Ajuga - Pink and purple varieties. Great November blooming groundcover for damp areas.
Aster - Early summer flowering variety in blue/lavender
Calamintha - new for us so I shall borrow the Chiltern seeds description. This is a most pleasant plant for your border or herb garden. Heavily scented with a fragrance described as pennyroyal-like, it is an erect perennial with small, somewhat hairy leaves. In summer it bears numerous whorled spikes of tiny blue flowers with long purple bracts. The herb can be used for flavouring. Flowers the first year from seed. 1½ft (45cm).
Campanula glomerata - deep purple
Cerastium - grey trailing leaves smothered in white blooms in Spring. (These have just been cut back)
Cerinthe - By popular demand. Technically an annual but a non invasive self sowing one so once its in your garden you'll have more each year. Glaucous foliage and interesting pendular purple blooms.
Dianthus - Grey leaves and red blooms
Erigeron multiradiatus - A beautiful evergreen groundcover with yellow centred purple/blue daisies from late spring.
Erysimum - a specialty for us as we love them so much. What's not to love? Front to mid border, semi shrubby evergreen perennial, glorious scented blooms and we have individual named colours.
Ivory, Purple bi-colour, Fire King, Vulcan, Ellen Willmott, Primrose, Ruby gem, Siberian allionii and the brand new Tangerine Titan.
Euphorbia - golden foam. Another newbie for us but we love the the chartreuse euphorbias add to the garden so we had to give it a go.
Euphorbia characias - the blue leaved evergreen semi shrubs with huge chartreuse heads that grace our garden every spring.
Geum - Yes, you guessed it, another favourite of ours. We have a good stock of the common types plus some more unusual ones.
Tall - Yellow, Red and Orange (Firestorm).
Dwarf - Deep orange/red, Lemon with hints of pink, blush (very pale pink) and the original geum rivale in a beautiful coppery peach.
Lunaria (Honesty). Two types available. Chedglow the purple leaf version that has taken Chelsea by storm the last couple of years. Variegata - the green leaves become edged in white in their second year before blooming with the typical mauve flowers.
Lysimachia nummularis - yellow creeping jenny. Great lime leaf trailing plant for part shady damp areas. One only.
Orlaya grandiflora - another favourite among designers. A self sowing annual that will provide weeks of beautiful white lacecap flowers. Perfect for filling in border spaces until the summer perennials fill in or to give a light airy feel to meadows and spring plantings. Seedlings will return year after year.
Pelargonium - Deep red
Pulmonaria - Raspberry splash
Romulea - small bulbs grow fine grassy leaves before erupting into a mass of deep rosy purple crocus type flowers in late spring.
Scabiosa - another specialty plant for us as they provide such amazing flower power all summer and autumn. They are not frost hardy but are perennial in sheltered spots for at least 3 years. Enjoy the flowers and at the end of the season collect several packets worth of seed to multiply your stock.
Named varieties available:
Snowmaiden - white, Black Knight - deep maroon, Beaujolias Bonnets - a gorgeous blend of pink, white and burgundy on the same flower, Burgundy beau - a new one this year, Salmon Queen - the most delicious shade of salmon pink. Pale yellow Fata morgana, and blue ones will be available later in the season.
Stachys officinalis - dark pink flowered evergreen groundcover. Perfect for the front of garden beds and rock gardens.
Sissyrinchium blue eyed grass. Low grassy leaves burst in to a mass of blue star shaped flowers in Spring.
Sedum mexicana - a bright lime evergreen succulent groundcover. Perfect for supporting bold tulips in spring and bright perennials in summer.
Sedum Mr Goodbud. A slightly pinker version than the well known Autumn joy.
Sparaxia - very special maroon flowers. Couple only.
Symphytum grandiflora - low-lying evergreen groundcover with medium sized leaves and stunning cream bell flowers all through spring. Excellent spreading plant for difficult to grow areas such as the shade of evergreen trees.
Urospermum - sown last spring and flowered for the first time in summer. Don't be put off by its dandelion looking leaves. This is a beauty with huge lemon flowers ( yes again like a dandelion but oh so much more beautiful). It has survived a wet winter in our gravel garden and also in soil. Definitely not a weed!
Violets - green leaf with white scented flowers and the later flowering purple leaved Viola labadorica with purple flowers.

description:
Warehouse Rave ft. Coki (UK), SYLC & Ghost Media Presents: WAREHOUSE RAVE FT. COKI
Friday 5th September
Secret Central Wellington Location (TO BE REVEALED ON EVENT DAY)
Powered by Banshee Soundsystem
8pm-2am
R18
Strictly limited capacity
Get ready Welly, because this one is about to be serious. We have secured the one and only COKI for an intimate warehouse rave at an inner city location.
This legend of bass needs no introduction, but we’ll give him one anyway. As one half of DIGITAL MYSTIKZ, Coki has made sine waves move like no other, architecting much of the sonic blueprint that modern dubstep has become known for. Alongside Mala, he helped forge the DMZ sound and is now making his way to Wellington for a rare showcase of pure low-frequency warfare. Expect heavyweight pressure, bone-rattling subs, and that unmistakable Coki wobble - this is dubstep in its rawest form.
On support we have drawn for the best of the best. Opening up proceedings we have BABETECH, champion selector and vibe master. Since murking opening slots for Loefah, Filth and Kahn & Neek as well as spreading the gospel of bass for countless evenings on RadioActive, we can’t think of a better opener for this night.
Following that, we have dubstep extraordinaire DUSTY warming things up with his signature and gruelling take on the classic dubstep sound. With releases on Infernal Sounds and Leather Kennel, Dusty has proven himself to be a force to be reckoned with, and is surely one of the most exciting young producers in the game today.
On closing duties we have the Support Your Local crew going b2b with Young Gho$t to round out the night with a bit of silliness.
We’ve managed to secure an all-new inner city warehouse location for this one, and its Further Sound on soundsystem duties this time, heating things up with their BANSHEE SOUNDSYSTEM, preparing for only its second full rollout after Cuba Dupa this year.
We’re unbelievably excited to share this space with you all for a dance and are expecting this to be one for the books.Secure your tickets now and don’t miss out on this momentous and legendary dance music event!
Tickets: https://events.humanitix.com/coki-uk-warehouse-rave

description:

Swing clarinetist Oscar Lavën, guitarist Adrian Jensen, and double-bass raconteur Robert Henderson are "Les Tripes" (french for "The Guts") ; a hard-working interpretation of the irresistibly heart-pumping film-noir sound of Django Reinhardt's Quintette du Hot Club de France. Lavën, Jensen and Henderson are professional musicians based in Wellington, and have honed their project through years of performance in venues large and small.

Les Tripes will have you tapping your feet and swinging along as they infuse each performance with passion, precision, and a touch of French flair.

Don’t miss the chance to experience a night of pure, swinging magic!

Book now to join us for a French inspired Set Menu from 5.30pm (served in one of our dining rooms) before moving out to the show.
2 courses $55.
BOOKINGS ESSENTIAL.
Email reservations@thistleinn.co.nz to book.

description:
The King's Singers, C L O S E H A R M O N Y
For over half a century, The King’s Singers have been synonymous with impeccable blend, radiant tone, and joyful music-making. Formed in 1968 by six choral scholars from King’s College, Cambridge, the group quickly earned an international reputation for their unique approach to “close harmony” — a seamless weaving of voices across centuries and styles. Today, their performances continue to enchant audiences from London to Los Angeles, and now, back in Aotearoa.
This bespoke programme, created especially for their March 2026 tour, offers a journey through The King’s Singers’ remarkable musical history. Beginning with their earliest repertoire from the late 1960s, the evening will move through Renaissance sacred music, English folksong, jazz standards, pop classics, and contemporary works. Expect Byrd alongside Billy Joel, madrigals alongside The Beach Boys, Disney magic alongside dazzling new arrangements from the songwriters of today.
The concert also carries a special significance — it will be one of the final New Zealand appearances for long-standing baritone Chris Bruerton. A proud Kiwi, Chris has been a cornerstone of The King’s Singers for over a decade, touring the world and helping shape their modern sound. His farewell tour offers Wellington audiences a rare chance to celebrate his artistry on home soil.
A highlight of the night will be the “Something Borrowed” segment, where the ensemble will present a pair of songs chosen especially for Wellington — a personal gift to the local audience, performed in their signature style.
With wit, warmth, and unparalleled musicianship, The King’s Singers promise an evening that is both a celebration of their legacy and a showcase of their continuing innovation. Whether you’ve followed their journey for decades or are hearing them for the first time, Close Harmony at Wellington Cathedral will be a night to remember.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Puku Rangi Tea – Rapa Nui Music & Dance Tour in Marlborough, Experience the vibrant culture of Easter Island as Puku Rangi Tea tours for the first time in Marlborough to closing the Welcoming Week Celebration!
Since 2012, they have been dedicated to preserving and showcasing traditional Rapa Nui music and dance. Their vibrant performances include the Hoko warrior dance, resonating with the spirit of the Māori Haka, storytelling through Takona body painting and ancestral narratives, Kai Kai string games and the rhythmic sounds of Tahitian ukulele and drums.
Puku Rangi Tea currently performs three shows a week at the Tahatai Hotel in Hanga Roa, Rapa Nui, and has participated in various festivals throughout its history, including:
Indigenous festival 2023–2024, San Juan de la Costa, Chile.
World Gathering of Folkloric Associations 2020, Lima, Peru.
International Festival 2018–2019, Málaga, Spain.
Chapultepec Forest Festival 2018, Mexico City, Mexico.
Second Workshop on Rapa Nui Music and Dance 2018, Mexico City, Mexico.
Rapa Nui Dance and Music Show 2018, Mexico City and Morelia, Michoacán, Mexico.
First Workshop on Rapa Nui Music and Dance 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
Rapa Nui Dance and Music Show 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
Indigenous festival 2016–2020, San Juan de la Costa, Chile.
Cultural Market 2017, Mexico City, Mexico.
12th Pacific Arts Festival 2016, Hagåtña, Guam.
Carnaval 2016, Arica, Chile.
Summer Festival 2016, Valdivia, Chile.
Oktoberfest Chile 2015–2017, Malloco, Chile.
Gala Puro Chile 2015, Miami, United States.
The tour holds significant cultural importance due to Rapa Nui deep ancestral connections with Aotearoa, offering a unique opportunity for cultural engagement and community connection.
Their itinerary includes high-profile engagements, such as:
Music Workshop on Friday 12 at 4pm - Koha Entry - RSVP Required
Dance Workshop on Friday 12 at 6pm - Koha Entry - RSVP Required
Concert: Live music and dances on Sunday 14 Spetember. Doors open at 3:30pm, Event start at 4pm
Koha - Entry - RSVP Required (Limited Capacity)
We are also excited to feature the local guest band "Matices", who will open the concert with a vibrant performance of live Andean and Latin American music.

description:
etu | Wellington, San Fran
AUSTRALIA/NZ
PRESENT
ETU
SUNFLOWER TOUR
Thursday 18 September 2025 Doors 7:30 PM

etu is a Tongan-American singer, songwriter, and storyteller whose music bridges cultures and generations. Blending island harmonies with mainstream aura, etu’s sound is deeply rooted yet powerfully contemporary. His debut album ‘Sunflower’ is a heartfelt exploration of identity, belonging, and gratitude — a celebration of Pacific pride and resilience. etu’s performances are more than just about the music — they’re tailored spiritual & personal experiences that uplift, connect, and inspire. From concerts in the South Pacific to major festival stages, etu is on a mission to bring light to his people and share their stories with the world.


"This tour is more than me playing songs – it’s about bringing the spirit of the islands to every stage," says etu. "I want people to leave feeling seen, uplifted, and part of something bigger than themselves." 

With songs in English, Tongan, Samoan, Fijian, and Chuukese, Sunflower is a rich tapestry of sound and storytelling – a heartfelt exploration of belonging, gratitude, and resilience.

description:
Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – Vogelmorn, Tom Cunliffe & Ali Whitton – big hearts, remarkable songs – on stage, with a collection of brand new tunes.
Doors at 7
Music at 7.30
The Upstairs Bar and Smoked and Pickled Restaurant will be open from 3pm, to book a table for pre-show kai email Alice at smokednpickled@gmail.com
-----------------
Tom Cunliffe writes folk songs like short films; vivid, offbeat, and full of heart. Based in Tamaki Makaurau, Auckland, he crafts lyrical worlds, with a guitar tuned sideways and a voice that balances gravity with joy.
Cunliffe has supported a number of internationally renowned artists including M. Ward, Grace Cummings, and Reb Fountain, bringing his mix of warmth, wit, and slow-burning intensity to stages near and far.
-----------------
Ali Whitton is an Aotearoa-born, Yorkshire-raised and now Wellington based singer-songwriter who is stepping into his own as an artist. Ali is an artist who refuses to let go, blending raw storytelling with a sound shaped by decades of experience and dedication to his craft.
Performing for years under the name Lost Bird, Ali built a reputation for writing heartfelt, melancholic folk-pop, playing everywhere from Wellington bars to stadium stages — including opening for Ed Sheeran in Auckland in 2018.
Now, after years of performing behind an alias, Ali is stepping forward under his own name, embracing his identity as an artist with an invigorated sense of purpose, and tackling his artistry with newfound confidence and clarity.
-----------------

description:
AWE Partnership Masterclass for Violists and Violinists with Yura Lee, Join us for a Masterclass!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge Festival, Orchestra Wellington will host AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee to present a masterclass for violinists and violists in Wellington.
Anyone can register to attend and observe the masterclass!
Visit https://orchestrawellington.co.nz/event/awe-masterclass-2025 to register to attend and observe the masterclass for FREE!
Violinist/violist Yura Lee is a multifaceted musician, as a soloist and as a chamber musician, and one of the very few that is equally virtuosic on both violin and viola. Her career spans three decades and takes her all over the world, captivating audiences through various musical mediums from baroque to modern, and enjoying a career that spans three decades and takes her all over the world. She has performed with major orchestras including those of New York, Chicago, Baltimore, Cleveland, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and given recitals in London’s Wigmore Hall, Vienna’s Musikverein, Salzburg’s Mozarteum, the Palais des BeauxArts in Brussels, and the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam.
At age 12, she became the youngest artist ever to receive the Debut Artist of the Year prize at the Performance Today awards given by National Public Radio. She is the recipient of a 2007 Avery Fisher Career Grant; she has received numerous other international prizes, including top prizes in the Mozart, Indianapolis, Hannover, Kreisler, Bashmet, and Paganini competitions. Yura Lee was the only first prize winner awarded across four categories at the 2013 ARD Competition in Germany.
An Incredible Partnership with At The World's Edge Festival!
As part of our 2025 partnership with At the World’s Edge (AWE) Festival, Orchestra Wellington is presenting a three-part series featuring AWE 2025 Festival Artist Yura Lee and AWE Artistic Director Benjamin Baker for a mini-series of concerts and a masterclass here in Wellington in addition to featuring these incredible artists' live performances with us on our subscription series concerts in September and October!

description:
MINUIT : The Reunion Shows | PŌNEKE (Wellington)
After over a decade away, legendary NZ electronic act Minuit are back – and bringing their iconic live show to Wellington.
..................................................................................................
This reunion makes us very happy because we thought it might never happen – ‘the Kiwi band with the French name’ are back together for a series of shows.
Singer, Ruth, describes the gigs as: "a chance to dance, laugh and sing (in my case, often the wrong words), together live one more time."
Minuit (minwee) became a must-see live act through the 2000s. Fronted by the enigmatic Ruth Carr, her coy persona ignites while bandmates Ryan Beehre and Paul Dodge forge rib-rattling beats around her.
Their debut album, The 88, released in 2003, achieved gold status in New Zealand, quickly followed up by the 'I Hate Guns' EP.
Over the following decade, the trio toured their synths and samplers from Helsinki to Hanoi crafting their own refreshing sound – storming The Crystal Method's club night in LA, the FabricLive birthday bash in London, and headlining the Hanoi Music Festival in Vietnam. Along with festivals and shows up and down Aotearoa.
Having been retired since 2014, we’re excited to announce that Minuit are back onstage for a limited number of reunion shows.
These reunion performances will pay tribute to classic tunes from all four albums 'The Boy with the Aubergine Hair', 'Except You', 'Fuji', 'Menace', ‘Aotearoa’, ‘I Hate Guns’, ‘A Room Full of Cute’, 'Last Night You Saw This Band', ‘25 Bucks’ – everything gets a look in, plus a couple of other surprises.
The show will be supported by Western Haikus and JOLA BURNS.
Minuit has a heart. And it beats loud. Real loud.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents Louisa Williamson, The ninth concert in this series of Aotearoa composers features the multi-talented saxophonist/composer Louisa Williamson. Since completing a Masters of Music in Composition in 2020, she has released two albums of original music (What Dreams May Come and Groundwork). In 2023 Louisa won the APRA Best Jazz Composition Award for her piece Dream Within A Dream, and in 2024 Louisa received a composition commission from the Wellington Jazz Festival and headlined the festival with the new work, The Chasm Where We Fall Into Each Other.  Louisa has worked with L.A.B, Bret McKenzie, AJA, The Rodger Fox Big Band, Royal NZ Air Force Band, Trinity Roots and Lord Echo.
"This commission opportunity has come at a perfect time for me to process some recent grief and pain that’s inhabited my circles. Whilst composing this music, I’ve thought about ideas around mental health, specifically with youth in Aotearoa, and also honouring some friends who have passed. I think artists have the ability to turn heartbreak into beauty, and this music is an attempt at that. Although the inspiration which generated the music is heavy, the performance itself will hopefully feel light and reflective (turning heartbreak into beauty = darkness into light!), and will embrace and celebrate the talents of the musicians who are playing. I’ve brought together a beautiful group of people who I know will handle this music with care and fortitude"
Bryn van Vliet - alto/flute
Tyaan Singh - alto sax
Louisa Williamson - tenor/flute
Eilish Wilson - baritone sax
Sylvester Green - trumpet
Kaia Johnstone - trumpet
Kaito Walley - trombone
Jakob Elijas - trombone
Anna Lee - euphonium
Sam Zhu - tuba
Leonardo Coghini - piano
Jacob Hurst - bass
Max Sheehan - drums
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.
Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.

description:
Christine Wang and Rachel Thomson -- Violin and Piano, Join us for Ravel's Violin and Piano Sonata No. 2 and de Falla's Suite Populaire Espagnole based on “Siete canciones populares españolas,” along with Ginastera's hauntingly beautiful Pampeana No. 1, Op. 16 - Rhapsody for Violin and Piano.

Christine Wang, violin

Christine has been a member of the second violin section of New Zealand Symphony Orchestra since 2022. She holds a Bachelor of Music from Eastman School of Music and Master of Music at Rice University, studying under Oleh Krysa and Kathleen Winkler respectively. Before coming to New Zealand, Christine was Assistant Concertmaster of San Antonio Symphony and has worked in orchestras in the United States and Australia.

Rachel Thomson, piano

Rachel Thomson was born in Dunedin, New Zealand, and grew up in Wellington where she began her piano studies with her mother. She went on to study with Judith Clark, graduating from Victoria University of Wellington before continuing her studies at the Cleveland Institute of Music in the United States, where she gained a doctorate in piano performance. Rachel regularly performs with some of the country’s leading musicians. She has toured on numerous occasions for Chamber Music New Zealand and is a member of various chamber ensembles including the Koru Trio. She has worked as an orchestral pianist with the NZSO, Orchestra Wellington, and the Christchurch Symphony Orchestra. Rachel is also active as a teacher, adjudicator and accompanist, and is a music examiner for Trinity College London.

description:
The Cowpokers + Tyson Smith, THE COWPOKERS: Foot-tappin' Onekaka Swamp Rock, World Famous in Golden Bay!

Golden Bay's finest local boys are rounding up and riding North to bring their unique brand of rock, blues and ska to the capital. What if swamp rock wasn't born in Louisiana, but in Takaka you ask? What if Iggy Pop and the Stooges had been Marlborough dairy farmers? What if Hendrix had settled in a Tukurua art gallery selling homemade jewellery crafted from shells and bone? The answer to all these questions and more can be found at a Cowpokers gig: a raw, barn-storming, rural-rock-and-roll sensation that 23 years of gigging has utterly failed to hone, polish, or refine.

TYSON SMITH: Wellington-based guitarist/singer/songwriter Tyson Smith will be bringing his unique, original music combining elements of rock, blues, folk, world music and freeform improvisation.

Tyson has worked as a guitarist with acts ranging from the New Zealand Symphony Orchestra to vocalist Hollie Smith, before focusing on his own music in the last few years.
In 2024 he celebrated 10 years since the release of his album The Hollow Tree with Rick Cranson and Ed Zuccollo, and released his new single Wolves. Tyson has been performing regularly around various New Zealand venues and festivals with his raw and exciting sound both with the trio and solo (utilising multiple amps and a bass drum).

description:
Echoes of Home: A Musical Journey Across Time, Event Information
Some days remind us who we are and where we come from — when an entire nation moves as one to honour Independence.
To celebrate the 80th Anniversary of Vietnam’s National Day (2 September), Viet Hub NZ proudly presents
“Echoes of Home – A Musical Across Time”
This free concert is a heartfelt journey through the sounds of Vietnamese history — from nostalgic childhood songs to powerful wartime ballads and modern melodies of pride and hope. All performances will include English subtitles, making it easy for everyone to follow along and connect with the stories.
Whether you’re Vietnamese or simply curious about a different culture, this is a wonderful opportunity to experience the warmth, resilience, and beauty of Vietnam through music and storytelling.
🎁 Raffle with Over $300 in Prizes
Don’t miss our special raffle on the day. Tickets will be available at the venue for $5 and $10. Payment can be made in cash or by bank transfer.
💛 Support Viet Hub NZ
This event is free to attend, but if you believe in what we do and want to help us continue running community workshops, cultural events, and youth-led initiatives — please consider making a donation.
👉 Donate here: https://givealittle.co.nz/cause/viet-hub-nz-rooted-in-culture-powered-by-community
Your koha helps keep our work going, rooted in culture, powered by community.

description:
Amanda Bunting and Kris Zuelicke, Solos and Duets for Piano, Leo Smit - Divertimento

Ginastera - No. 2 from Danzas Argentinas, op. 2 - "Danza de la moza donosa"

Ravel - Sonatine, M. 40, Movement I - Modéré

Schubert - "Lebensstürme," Allegro in A minor, D 947

Amanda Bunting is a graduate of the New Zealand School of Music, completing her Bachelor of Music with Honours in 2019 in solo piano performance with Dr. Jian Liu; small group ensemble with Dr. Rolf Gjelsten; and performance and embodiment studies with Dr. Hamish Robb and Dr. Margaret Medlyn. Prior to that, she completed a Graduate Diploma in Music in performance piano, performance studies, and pedagogy.

After previously studying with Gillian Bibby at the Conservatorium of Music and graduating in 1996, Amanda chose to return to study to further develop performance skills, enhance her own piano performance abilities and to gain further knowledge that can be shared with her piano students. Amanda is an Associate of the Institute of Registered Music Teachers New Zealand, a member of the Wellington Branch and currently works both as a Piano Teacher and a Human Resources Adviser at Victoria University of Wellington.

Kris Zuelicke grew up in a theatrical and musical family, accompanying shows and choirs from high school onwards. In the USA, she gained degrees in Music (BA Miami University) and Music Theory (MA Indiana University) and taught music along with other subjects at the Bloomington Montessori School.

In Karlsruhe, Germany Kris taught at the Landau Montessori School, Berlitz Language School, courses on theatre and music at the Teacher’s College and piano privately. She studied with Annemi Egri and Sariel Maler during this time.

Kris currently teaches in five schools around Wellington, maintains a thriving private piano and cello studio and accompanies students at the New Zealand School of Music. Her most recent degree is in harpsichord performance (DMA NZSM), including study and research in Boston with Mark Kroll. Kris enjoys performing regularly with other musicians, including piano duets, chamber music and has enjoyed projects with Stroma, the Queen’s Closet and a fun stint as a harpsichordist extra in the recently released Time Bandits.
label: Music & Concerts

description:

description:
The Racket Lounge: Session Three, Grab a spot on our couch and enjoy the noise at The Racket Lounge, a chill classical music series featuring up-and-coming Pōneke classical and jazz musicians.

Last year the NZSQ Trust launched the Racket Lounge, a concert series for classical and jazz musicians with experience ranging from students to pros to freely express their creativity in a non-traditional concert setting. It was a huge success, with over 250 audience members and 52 artists over our four sessions. Audiences were raving about the musical variety and great talent they found at the Racket Lounge, and as one audience member commented; “Well done…do it again!” So, we listened, and the Racket Lounge is back for round two! Once again hosted at Bedlam & Squalor (above the Rogue & Vagabond), we welcome audiences, composers and performers back for another four concerts full of innovative, fun, and chill music. From classical to pop covers, video game soundtracks to original compositions, there's something for everyone to sink their teeth into at The Racket Lounge!

Even if you've never been to a classical music concert before, this one is for you. With a 'Choose your price' model you can afford to give it a go - and you might even find something you like!

A Flexible Price, So You Can Take A Chance on Something New:
Our prices range from $5 to $100, just pick the ticket price you feel like paying. At The Racket Lounge, we believe everyone should have access to high-quality but affordable art. If you're a bit strapped for cash right now, but still want a good night out, no worries! Just book yourself a $5 ticket! If you can afford to pay a little more and want to do some good for your community, then pick one of our higher ticket prices and rest assured that your dollars are going towards funding great, accessible art in your city.

All proceeds from ticket sales will go directly into presenting the next Racket Lounge, including paying musicians and artists, hiring instruments and marketing costs. Plus, by choosing a higher price point, you're ensuring that we're able to continue to offer tickets at a lower price point for those who need it.

Please note: Bedlam & Squalor is a licenced venue, so under 18s must be accompanied by a parent or legal guardian. Everyone must bring ID.
label: Music & Concerts

description:

When songwriters think, often the result is songs. It’s time to bring out some of these new thought babies from the writing suite and expose them to the light; let them photosynthesise and become real and alive in the world.


The Silver Scroll, Taite and Tūī winning artist brings his engaging show of (new and old) songs and talk, accompanied by guitar and keys, to Meow.


With support from Frances Grass.

description:

enchanting evening of Celtic-inspired music that promises to get your feet tapping and your ears thumping. This large ensemble draws on both new and traditional melodies, reimagined in a style that reflects Rae’s cultural roots and personal musical journey. Experience a vibrant celebration of Celtic heritage through engaging rhythms and rich harmonies that showcase the versatility and depth of contemporary Celtic music.
John has recorded over 30 albums as a leader and side man including two BBC Jazz Albums of the Year (2003 and 2004). He has performed with the Scottish National Jazz Orchestra, was the first ever Jazz Composer in Residence at Victoria University, has written music for the NZSO/Wellington Jazz Orchestra and RNZAF Concert Band, and has toured internationally with his eclectic chamber ensemble "The Troubles".
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers. Concerts take place every 1st and 3rd Friday of the month, from May to October, from 7pm. Tickets are $15, door sales $20.

Thanks to Creative New Zealand for their generous support.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Jazz in Martinborough 2025, Big Band Brings Back the Swing
Jazz in Martinborough 2025

Jazz in Martinborough is thrilled to be bringing you the Royal New Zealand Airforce Jazz Orchestra as our feature act on Saturday at the festival for 2025.

“We’re delighted to be able to fill the stage with a full-sized big band of fabulous musicians, and the Town Hall with the fantastic sounds of the big band era,” says Jazz in Martinborough Music Director Lee Quayle.

Jazz in Martinborough is back for their 13th edition during the first weekend in September with ticketed shows on Friday 5th and Saturday 6th and other gigs around town as usual. “The RNZAF Jazz Orchestra will be one of our ticketed gigs, featuring on the Saturday evening,” says Lee. “And on Friday night we invite you to Be Transported back in time to a speak easy club with the superb swing and blues combo that is April’s Fools,” adds Lee.

Staying true to the tradition of swing and improvisation the RNZAF Jazz Orchestra draws on their own rich history dating back to the original ‘swing era’. The Orchestra is a national trailblazer in big band history and features New Zealand compositions, and a classic repertoire from the golden era of big band swing jazz of Ellington and Basie.

The band benefits from a depth of talent that most military bands around the world would only dream of and is made up of Wellington’s most exceptional musicians.

“The line-up will be a who’s who of the Wellington jazz scene,” says Lee. “It’s a while since we had a big band at the festival, so we’re elated to have the Airforce Jazz Orchestra back with us again. They last played at the festival in 2014. Many of the band members have been here since, but not as part of a big band,” says Lee.

Be Transported by April’s Fools
Imagine stepping back in time to a speak easy club. A smoky, dimly lit room where the anticipation is electric but the vibe is laid-back and relaxed. . .

From the stage a jazz swing and blues band begins to play, their instruments blending seamlessly in a harmonious symphony of sound. The rhythm section, with its upright bass and snare drums, lays down a groove that's impossible to resist, while the saxophone punctuates the air with soulful notes.

At. the forefront stands a captivating female singer, her voice rich and velvety, weaving tales of heartache, joy, and everything in between. Her vocal prowess brings both swing and blues to life, effortlessly moving from sultry, slow blues ballads to energetic, foot-tapping swing numbers.

This band doesn't just play music; they create an experience that transports the audience to another era, where the essence of jazz and blues reigns supreme.

Welcome to an evening of superb swing jazz and blues brought to you by the band that is April’s Fools. “We’re absolutely wrapt to be bringing this ultra-talented and experienced combo to the festival,” says Music Director Lee Quayle. “Whenever, and wherever this group of musicians have played reviewers have to search the thesaurus for new superlatives to describe the show, and audiences leave reluctantly, but happy.”

April’s Fools are April Phillips (vocals), Greg Crayford (drums), Zak Dikvert (guitar), Nicholas Bauke-Maunsell (saxophone), Miles Crayford (keyboards) and RoryMacartney (bass). They will be playing at Jazz in Martinborough on Friday 5 September 2025 as the opening of the ticketed festival gigs to be held in the Town Hall.
label: Music & Concerts

description:
Wairarapa Youth Orchestra: Around The World With Music, Get ready for a global classical musical journey as the Wairarapa Youth Orchestra presents their special concert, “Around the World with Music”!
The vibrant sounds of violins, flutes, cellos, trombones, and more will fill the Wairarapa Events Centre, Carterton as our young musicians from across the Wairarapa share their hard work. These talented tamariki and rangatahi are now ready to take you on an unforgettable adventure through sound.

Under the expert guidance of conductor Andrew Atkins and our dedicated tutors, the Wairarapa Youth Orchestra has been diligently preparing a diverse program that celebrates music from various continents. Prepare to be captivated by everything from the rhythmic pulse of African drums to the sweeping melodies of European symphonies, including the grandeur and pomp of Tchaikovsky’s 1812 Overture, and evocative folk tunes echoing the sounds of Asia. It’s a unique opportunity to experience a rich tapestry of sounds, all brought to life by the passion and talent of our local youth.

This inspiring event is more than just a performance; it’s a vital fundraiser. The Wairarapa Youth Orchestra offers free orchestral music learning to young people throughout the Wairarapa, and we rely entirely on fundraising and donations to keep this invaluable program thriving. Your attendance directly supports the continued musical education of our community’s youth.

New works by Wellington's own Jonathan Berkahn sit alongside a vibrant selection of madrigals that capture the joy, longing, and playful spirit that love inspires.

Experience the vibrant rhythms, melodies, and traditions of Rapa Nui in this unique Music Workshop led by the Internationally renowned Cultural Performing Group Puku Rangi Tea from Easter Island.

With a legacy of timeless hits and soulful performances, South Border has touched audiences across generations. This special evening offers fans in New Zealand the rare opportunity to experience their music live — up close and personal.
Whether you're reconnecting with the songs you love or discovering them for the first time, this concert promises an atmosphere of warmth, energy, and musical brilliance.

description:

A world bound by modding cars, immigrant heritage and digital obsessions, Kevin Stathis, Haydn Green and Luca Watson, together play a left-field breed of punk that recalibrates their formal training to its most uncustomary extremes.

Wherever they play and no matter the room size, devout adherents clammer to propel a heaving mosh. Experience TREK live as Shady Nasty debut the record with an all-new live show, with special guests to be announced.

Known for their sharp lyricism, driving basslines and chaotic-but-considered live shows, the four-piece are bringing their wiry energy and weird charm to stages across the motu. Life Advice is a hook-heavy record full of tightly wound rhythms, jagged guitars and lines that sound like overheard wisdom from a mate you probably shouldn’t be listening to.

Monteverdi Vespers (Vespro della Beata Vergine of 1610), Join award-winning choir The Tudor Consort for our major project of the year! This will be the first time this groundbreaking work has been performed in Wellington for over a decade.


Juxtaposing Renaissance melodies and polyphony with the rich virtuosity and colour of Baroque instruments, intimate vocal solos with a choir and orchestra of unprecedented grandeur, and dazzling opulence with striking emotional and spiritual depth, this will be an unmissable performance



We are thrilled to be joined by an incredible orchestra of top musicians from the NZSO and leading international artists! Come hear the striking tones of cornetti, dulcian, archlutes, Baroque recorders and more!

description:
BANDIT QUEEN @ The Boathouse, Nelson, BANDIT QUEEN is NZ's finest (likely only) tribute to the music of The Decemberists.A Tribute to the Decemberists? BUT WHO ARE THE DECEMBERISTS?
Hailing from Portland Oregon, The Decemberists is an indie-alt folk rock band that write epic songs and have 9 studio albums to their credit. They are renowned for their musical style and unique storytelling with many song lyrics based on historical incidents and folklore. Perhaps drawing musical influence from the likes of The Beatles, Tom Waits, REM, Morrisey, their songs are exquisitely constructed and effortlessly combine folk-rock with elements of pop creating the infectious sound that is The Decemberists.
And who is BANDIT QUEEN? Experienced Christchurch based musos - Tim Kent (vocals, acoustic guitar); Justin 'Rusty' White (lead guitar); Jo-Anne Davern Fuller (vocals, keyboard); Chiara Lowe (violin, vocals); Adam Lowe (bass); Mark Newburn (drums, percussion).
The members of BANDIT QUEEN are passionate about this project and invite you to come experience and enjoy the eclectic music of USA indie-rock band THE DECEMBERISTS.

description:
Yoko–Zuna: A Live Tribute to KAYTRANADA tickets, This October, Aotearoa electronic/progressive hip-hop powerhouse Yoko-Zuna will make their long anticipated return to Pōneke, presenting the music of KAYTRANADA in the city's magnificent Meow NUI. Over the past decade Yoko-Zuna have firmly established themselves as one of the country’s most exciting live acts and a favourite on the festival circuit. Just back from a world tour with hip-hop multihyphenate CHAII, the four piece made up of Swap Gomez, J.Y Lee, Kenji Iwamitsu-Holdaway, & Frank Eliesa once again join forces to perform their live tribute to a genre-defying beat wizard.
Louis Kevin Celestin aka KAYTRANADA is a Haitian-Canadian record producer and DJ. He first made waves in 2010 with a steady stream of mixtapes, remixes, and original tracks released under the name Kaytradamus. By 2013, reintroducing himself as KAYTRANADA, he was turning heads across the global music scene. The momentum only grew—by 2014, he landed a deal with the influential label XL Recordings. In 2016, he dropped his debut studio album, 99.9%, which was met with widespread critical acclaim. 2019’s Bubba—a genre-blurring triumph earned him two Grammy Awards, including Best Dance/Electronic Album, solidifying his place as one of the most innovative voices in contemporary music.
label: Music & Concerts
